summary: In this context, 1,1,2-trichloroethene and toluene are both classified as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are regulated due to their impact on air quality. They are mentioned alongside other VOCs, such as benzene and ethylbenzene, indicating they share a common category as organic compounds with specific boiling point ranges. However, there is no detailed discussion of their specific interactions or relationships beyond their classification as VOCs.
